review_title: Great Culture- Best place to work
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Traverse City, MI
pros: The culture at NMC is fantastic. Staff, faculty and students appear happy to be here and are very friendly to newcomers. The benefits are way better than previous organizations I have worked for. You feel truly valued at NMC.
cons: There is nothing I can think of as a con.

job_title: Lab Assistant in Traverse City, MI
pros:
Lots of free time to complete classwork 

Working in the audio tech department was a dream with loads of instruments at your disposal

Pay isn't too bad for a college job

Laid back environment
cons: Hard to get many hours as the university limits you to 20 per week

pros: This is a great place to work.

job_title: Director, Academic Technology in Traverse City, MI
pros: Friendly, community orientated, great onboarding process, inclusive. Good benefits and retirement options.
cons: Set salary for each position. No negotiating salary when offered a position.

review_title: Excellent college for students, employees, and the community
pros: Positive atmosphere. Student focused. Supportive environment. Forward thinking. Community oriented. Caring administrators, faculty and staff. Wonderful place to work.
cons: None. Everyone at the college works extremely hard and corrects issues or problems when they occur.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Traverse City, MI
pros: NMC is a very organized system, and all staff have been helpful during my 1st 90 days as an adjunct instructor. I love working with the students and my fellow colleagues have been very helpful with any questions. I would highly recommend teaching at NMC.
cons: The only con is that I would like to teach more classes and become a full time employee-- but I will settle for adjunct now.

pros:
The people and working environment are great. Very fun and engaging especially the it department!

Tuition free education is tops.
cons: Pay is about what you would expect at a public educational institution.

job_title: Front Office Assistant in Traverse City, MI
pros: flexible schedule, many different project options

review_title: Great Place to Be, But Always Room for Improvement
pros: I've been in my role for about 3 months now. The campus is wonderful, the people are great, and I enjoy working with the students. There is a lot of effort by HR to incorporate culture and general NMC training in your first couple of months.
cons: The hiring process for me was very slow. After I interviewed, I didn't hear anything back for over a month and assumed I did not get the position. The only major area that I've found lacking since I've started is training specific to my role.

job_title: Culinary Assistant in Traverse City, MI
pros: I have worked at the Culinary School associated with  Northwestern Michigan College for over 90 days now. It is a fun, positive work environment  that keeps me learning on a day to day basis. I am a graduate of the program as of Fall 2017. I was offered the position and really didn't have to think twice about taking the job.  My coworkers and mentors are probably the best part about my job because with them it does not feel like i am going to work every day.
cons: I do not really have any cons about my job. Some times I do not always hit 40 hours every week but that is more based on personal decisions.

review_title: High Quality Community College with great resources!
job_title: Student Success Coach in Traverse City, MI
pros: Northwestern Michigan College gives students an educational opportunity that includes quality instruction and a high level of student resources! It is a positive and helpful environment for staff and students.
cons: My position is fairly new and so there was not a structured training program. I have had to teach myself how to best perform my job but there is always someone willing to help.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Traverse City, MI
pros: Great people, good communications from leadership, great vision for where colleges are headed in the future.  Beautiful facilities.
cons: Very few.  Short-term housing is very difficult to find in Traverse City so relocation can be tricky.  It can often be hard for a spouse to find a good job, because TC is small.  But once settled, it is a great place to live.

job_title: Student Office Assistant in Traverse City, MI
pros: The other faculty are nice, and if I need help there is always someone I can go to.
cons: On a good day parking is difficult. On a bad day, the only spots available are in the far end of the back lot.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Traverse City, MI
pros: Excellent EMT team and support to innovate.
cons: Not enough students to guarantee employment overtime.

job_title: Residence Hall Manager in Traverse, MI
pros:
-benefits package 
-Housing included
-friendly people 
-Professional Development opportunities
-Great Boss
cons:
- late hours at times 
- very little rascal and cultural diversity
